StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Integrated Genomic Analyses of Cutaneous T Cell Lymphomas Reveal the Molecular Bases for Disease Heterogeneity

Policy.acknowledgement_statement:
Instructions: Approved Users are expected to acknowledge the Submitting Investigator(s) who submitted data from the original study to an NIH-designated data repository, the primary funding organization that supported the Submitting Investigator(s), and the NIH-designated data repository (e.g., dbGaP). The acknowledgment statement should include the dbGaP accession number to the specific version of the dataset(s) analyzed.
We acknowledge the patients, the Northwestern Skin Disease Research Center, Flow Cytometry Core, the Northwestern University Research Computing Services, and Admera Health for their invaluable contributions. J.C. was supported in part by the National Institutes of Health (K08- CA191019-01A1, 1DP2AI136599-01), the Skin Cancer Foundation, the Leukemia Research Foundation, the Doris Duke Charitable Foundation, and the Damon Runyon Foundation (DRCRF# CI-84-16, DDCF# 2016095, DDCF CRM Award). J.D. was supported in part by NIH/NCI training grant T32 CA009560. J.R. was supported by research grants from the Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft (SFB 1054/B01; Projektnummer 360372040 – SFB 1335/P01 and SFB 1335/P08; and Projektnummer 395357507 – SFB 1371/P05, TRR 237/A10, and RU 695/9-1) and the European Research Council under the European Union’s Horizon 2020 research and innovation program (grant agreement no.834154).

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use (IRB)
ConsentGroup.name: GRU-IRB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.
